result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Olivia M Herlache was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work, school or combination of the two. Complete high school or obtain a GED/HSED.
Commit no further criminal acts during the period of this agreement. Consume no alcohol beverages or controlled substances. No entry into bars or taverns. Not to possess drug paraphernalia.

Defendant shall comply with any and all rules of probation and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as part of this case. Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office. Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted. This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.

Complete an Alcohol and/or Other Drug Abuse (AODA) Assessment with a certified Alcohol and Drug Abuse Counselor, at an appropriate counseling or treatment center and willingly cooperate in any recommended counseling or treatment. The defendant must ensure that the counselor sends the written results of said assessment to the Defendant's probation agent on or before: 60 days of the date of this agreement. If counseling is recommended, the defendant must ensure that the counselor sends written documentation of the defendant's attendance and compliance with any recommendation to the District Attorney's Office by: not less than 60 days before the date set for sentencing below.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall perform 50 hours of uncompensated community service, providing proof of such community service to the Door County District Attorney's office at least thirty (30) days before the expiration of this agreement.

miscConds.notes: Costs have been paid in full from cash bond previously posted. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.
Perform 50 hours of uncompensated community service for a non-profit or government agency.

Defendant Olivia M Herlache in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas on Counts 2, 3, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2, 3. Court finds basis to accept plea on Count 1, defers acceptance of plea, reviews conditions contained within DAGPA, accepts DAGPA. Court reviews collateral consequences of possible felony conviction, maximum penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond continues as is.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 7, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Olivia M Herlache in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer, thinks they're close to resolution, requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Olivia M Herlache in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises of offer that will probably resolve case, hasn't picked up/reviewed discovery. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for March 7, 2016 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.
by State

Defendant Olivia M Herlache in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Olivia M Herlache in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
by Veronica Herlache

Defendant Olivia M Herlache appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 1/4/16, 10:00.
